subtitle: Psychological singing ~ this is something that you can contemplate on in order to deepen
your meditation, in order to deepen your self comprehension, and this is an aspect of
our consciousness, of the way we are, that is more easily observable in other people
like many things to do with 'knowing ourselves' it's always a lot easier to see in others right
so i'll give you some examples of what this psychological singing is or in other words
these psychological songs that we play within ourselves; you see
in terms of awakening, of knowing ourselves, we usually think of
our you know in terms of meditation we usually think in terms of just thoughts right
random thoughts here and there but a deeper reality and a better way to describe this is
that we have many songs playing within ourselves whether they are harmonies or disharmonies
and the thing about these psychological songs is that they are an accumulation of
past things within us in other words they are an accumulation of thoughts and feelings and
judgments and beliefs, prejudices, opinions and all of these things come together to create
this sound within our psyche within our consciousness so thoughts are not just
thoughts but they have a whole range of spectrum of feeling within ourselves so
you know i say to comprehend this psychological singing because it helps us to better integrate
ourselves more deeply or integrate our you know shadow right our ego because you know
a lot of the time in meditation or when we talk about meditation we usually think in
terms of you know sitting very peacefully uh just listening to a nice sound but that's not
really the purpose of meditation right the purpose of meditation or a big aspect of meditation is
arriving at deeper levels of being and in order to arrive at deeper levels of being
we need to understand that we need to observe and become aware of these many layers of sounds
of inner sounds or of psychological songs and by observing these psychological songs and the way we
are and the songs that we play to ourselves which determine the beliefs about ourselves
then we are better able to observe ourselves more purely more clearly and objectively
so the psychological song what is a psychological song well we can very much easily see it
when someone is always saying the same thing about themself it may be about themselves or
it may be about a certain drama perhaps they had a certain divorce or about another relationship or
it might be about a world drama that someone feels uh very angry about or it might be about
their boss at work or someone that they are just not getting along with um this is
and then this becomes a repeated psychological song it has a certain vibration a certain feeling
and this person keeps playing this this record track in their mind in their life and
it becomes an outer song in the way that they express themselves about this certain situation
or drama so and then eventually uh you know people get sick and tired of hearing the same song right
and then maybe one day uh that friend tells the other person you know i'm really sick and
tired of you saying this same thing and then the other person gets maybe sad or angry or offended
and says you know you don't understand when the reality is the person who keeps saying that song
is the one who does not understand or more specifically they don't understand
they don't comprehend themselves because if they really comprehended themselves
or comprehended this song that they keep playing then they wouldn't sing it all the time would they
so in this way the song happens to them rather than them singing the song they are
determined or they are controlled or possessed by the song they don't know how to you know turn
off the song in a way subconsciously they enjoy the song and this is a form of self-pity right
so that's just one example of a psychological song another example would be that
perhaps a person gets bullied growing up or you know certain people say certain comments
negative comments uh about them uh and they say you know you are ugly you are useless you are a
horrible person uh nobody likes you etc so if the person or the victim or the person on the
receiving end of that is not conscious in those moments they turn this into a sort of self-pity
and they sort of believe what this person is saying well if this person this victim is not
conscious during those moments is not observing his internal psychological state what will he do
he will turn this into a psychological song and uh you know especially like growing up right
a lot of us you know grow up like this and then we we have these thoughts we have these emotions and
beliefs about ourselves and this is more uh called an internal psychological song a psychological
song that we don't tell others but is within ourselves so you know no uh it's rare for maybe
like a therapist or something or a psychologist to notice these things this is something totally
internal and only we can discover for ourselves so this person may have certain feelings about
themselves and you know it's good to call it a "song" this is where it's effective to call it a
song rather than observable logical thoughts because they're more about a feeling within us
a perceptible intelligent feeling that we can observe if we if we are refined in
our understanding of ourselves and so this person can say things like or this inner psychological
song can not say but imply that i am not good enough i'm so ugly i'm not worthy to be loved
nobody loves me and this can become a song right um and it forms who that person becomes
maybe that person likes to then listen to very sad music or likes to play on the guitar and
sing very sad songs so you know i'm not saying this is wrong but i'm saying that it is important
to self-comprehend ourselves and what kind of person that we are so everyone has their own song
so you know if we can stop thinking in terms of words to describe a person uh you know think of
all the people that you know in your own life and try to think of them not so much with your own
judgments of of descriptive words about them but try to hear what those people sound like
and the kind of life that they live and the kind of things that they say there is a very
discernible feeling a sensation of a certain music about themself a psychological music or a psychic
music and so if we live our life and you know this is where uh these strong especially negative
psychological songs become dangerous because if we live our life with these strong negative
psychological songs that we play to ourselves that we have a self-pity in all the time this is when
life becomes very monotonous very boring very depressive you know it leads to depression and
because we don't have any intelligent observation of it we are possessed by it we don't have
a space between the observer and the observed we are just essentially on the observed side right
so meditation is about placing ourselves in a point of observation right because when we are
observing when we are the observer then we can see the observed parts of ourselves
and uh that's you know one point of meditation so yes psychological songs are certain thoughts that
come with certain feelings whether good or bad and they're usually memories that help us uh or
make us feel a certain way and so they're just like you know radio stations that we tune into
and if we don't like a certain song we change the the station and much of the time they can
be negative thoughts or negative songs and disharmonic songs but we don't want to change the
station because we're enjoying our self-pity or that we think it is a part of us that it is part
of our identity that it makes us who we are but we it is simply a song and we are not the song but we
are the person who is able to change the station and on these different stations are just different
narrators narrators about uh different narratives of uh you know the certain song you know when you
turn on a real radio in real life each song has its own narrative right uh usually about
love and romance and relationships and similarly you know a lot of people play the same
songs about their own relationships and that life uh or it is about you know the the life
about themself or the relationship with themselves because you know we love ourselves a lot so we
have these songs about ourselves and what we believe about ourselves and you know why do these
songs come about in our mind it's usually because of some kind of suffering that we you know went
through in the past and then we form certain beliefs about ourselves and say you know this
person shouldn't have done this to me i didn't deserve that and we simply say this to ourselves
over and over again and we share the same thing with others over and over again and there's even
you know maybe spiritual songs that we play to ourselves maybe we believe that we are a very
enlightened mystical magical person and so we don't want to go into meditation with a song right
we want to attain inner silence in a stillness but if we aren't aware of these songs then we are
you know not having that inner stillness and even though you can't actually hear
a song it affects the meditation it affects how deeply you can penetrate into yourself because
you know you're sitting there thinking that uh or reveling in or enjoying yourself that you are
a very mystical enlightened magical person when if you could go beyond that belief or beyond that
song then you would be able to find a deeper stillness within yourself and so of course
these psychological songs of course they create our reality as well right a person who is always
very angry with the world about maybe politics or science etc uh you know we keep playing
these songs to ourselves certain things that we maybe don't like etc and so we attract uh people
in the same manner in the same spirit you know people who do certain drugs they uh
attract people who do the same drugs and so what are we to do with all these songs that we keep
playing within ourselves well we simply want to turn them off uh yes we want to eliminate them
in order to find some inner peace i mean a stillness uh so and you know it's not that
we need to turn off all the songs but uh generally speaking because you know we are not
awakened and because our consciousness is sleeping uh we can assume that there are many many
negative lower limiting songs within ourselves and so the process of turning off those songs is
to simply study ourselves to observe ourselves to contemplate and reflect on our past on our
history and how that has conditioned ourselves going forward and how those certain uh certain
songs about ourselves have developed and have been created over time perhaps
there was a certain dramatic event uh perhaps we just simply have a lot of
a lot of uh pride or opinions about a certain thing and we just enjoy being in those songs so
yes this psychological song is a principle from the gnostic teachings and it's just a nice way
to understand how certain thoughts are not just thoughts but they combine a whole spectrum of
emotion behind them and it adds a new layer a new dimension of self-comprehension not just on
a thought-based intellectual level but a whole way of comprehension in our entire being and in our
emotions and how we feel about ourselves the world of the people and how that limits us and how that
forms our approach to many things and how we lose a lot of energy because sometimes when
we are so engrossed in certain songs about certain narratives in our life uh they can
become very strong and they drain a lot of energy and that's when we become very lethargic uh like
a you know like a kind of weight here we feel very tired very sleepy we say oh i'm exhausted
i you know really it's because we've we're thinking so much and then we get headaches as well
so yes uh this aspect of listening to ourselves talk to ourselves uh um we say this a lot to other
people right you know look in the mirror or have you heard yourself have you hear the way you sound
and we're often not aware because of our deeply entrenched identification with our emotions
to do with certain thoughts certain songs okay... so yes what is your psychological song?
